title: Seizure of Multiple Semi-Automatic Assault Rifles  - TAMPS
name: Seizure of Multiple Semi-Automatic Assault Rifles  - TAMPS

properties.weapon details: Two AK-47 assault rifles were seized during the arrest.
properties.event summary: 10/05/2011:  On Wednesday, in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico, Federal Police personnel arrested three alleged members of the Gulf Cartel. Federal Police personnel were investigating a report of armed men traveling in a black vehicle with tinted windows on the Carretera Ciudad Victoria-Matamoros. The individuals were identified as Rusbel Javier Pena Rojas, Joel Ramos Flores, and Andres Bocanegra Gonzalez. During the arrest, police also seized two AK-47 assault rifles, one .223 caliber assault rifle, one .40 caliber Smith and Wesson pistol loaded with 11 rounds of ammunition, one fragmentation grenade, three magazines for a .223 caliber weapon, 19 magazines for a 7.62x39mm weapon, 290 7.62x39mm bullets, 160 .223 caliber bullets, one bulletproof vest, one cartridge carrier, three cartridge belts, eight radio chargers, 12 radios, one frequency radio, $(MXN) 11650, $(USD) 28, and one padlock. The arrest occurred while the men were traveling in a 2010 Volkswagen Bora with no license plate, which was reported stolen on 09/16/2011.  The vehicle was located at the junction that leads to Valle Hermoso or Francisco Gonzalez Villarreal.
properties.weapon details 2: One .223 caliber assalt rifle was seized during the arrest.
properties.weapon details 3: One .40 caliber Smith and Wesson pistol loaded with 11 rounds of ammunition was seized during the arrest.
properties.location: The arrest occurred at the intersection of Vallehermoso and Francisco Bonzalez Villareal in Tamaulipas, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Federal Police Arrest Three Gulf Cartel Members in Valle Hermoso, Tamaulipas, Mexico

properties.weapon details: Five rifles were seized during the arrest.
properties.event summary: 10/10/2011:  On Monday, in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel detained four armed men for armed assault.  The men were arrested while attacking the military personnel.  During the arrest, military personnel recovered five rifles, one pistol, 1239 bullets of various calibers, 51 magazines of various calibers, and one vehicle.  No damages were reported.
properties.weapon details 2: One pistol was seized during the arrest.
properties.location: The arrests occurred in Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Military Personnel Detain Four Armed Men in Miguel Aleman, Mexico

properties.weapon details: 15 rifles were seized during the military operation.
properties.event summary: 10/23/2011:  On Sunday, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, Military personnel were attacked by unidentified armed men.  The military personnel returned fire and resulted in the deaths of five armed perpetrators.  Military personnel seized 15 rifles, three handguns, three grenades, 152 magazines, 4164 rounds of ammunition, and four vehicles.  No damages were reported.
properties.weapon details 2: Three handguns were seized during the military operation.
properties.location: The military operation occurred in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Military Personnel Kill Five in Reynosa, Mexico

properties.weapon details: Four rifles were seized during the military operation.
properties.event summary: 10/23/2011:  On Sunday, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico, military personnel detained four individuals and seized four rifles, 23 magazines, 622 rounds of ammunition, and one fuel tanker with 15000 liters of fuel.  No damages or casualties were reported.
properties.location: The military operation occurred in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Military Personnel Detain Four People in Reynosa, Mexico

properties.event summary: 12/08/2011: On Thursday, in Reynosa and Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico, the Secretary of National Defense reported, in the 8/a. military zone, in different events, that the following was seized by the military: one suspect was arrested, 1,047 packets of marijuana, weighing 4,314 kilograms, $50,000 USD, four rifles, 69 magazines, 2,038 bullets of different calibers, a vehicle, three antennas, two voltage regulated sources, three repeaters (for computers), and two duplexes (for computers). The detainee was handed over to the proper authorities along with the seized items.
properties.location: The specific location for the military operation occurred in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, Mexico.
properties.basic title: Military Seized More Than Four Tons of Marijuana and $50,000 USD in Reynosa and Miguel Aleman, Tamaulipas, Mexico
